Submodules

tungeon.config.game_config module

class tungeon.config.game_config.GameConfiguration(configuration_folder)[source]

Bases: object

This class represents the game settings. You can imagine this the explaination of the world. This is the python implementation. Rule of thumb: replace ‘_’ with ‘-’ and you receive the attribute name in json.

ITEMS_FILENAME = 'items.json'

filename for items configuration

LANGUAGEPACKAGE_FILENAME = 'language_package.json'

filename for language package

PROFESSIONS_FILENAME = 'professions.json'

filename for professions configuration

RACES_FILENAME = 'races.json'

filename for professions configuration

REGIONS_FILENAME = 'regions.json'

filename for regions configuration

REWARDSETS_FILENAME = 'rewardsets.json'

filename for rewardsets configuration

SKILLS_FILENAME = 'skills.json'

filename for skills configuration

property items: list[Item]

list of all items available in this world. if an item is not listed here it does not exist.

property language_package: LanguagePackage

Language Package to enable use of different language via configuration versus hard-codding, currently underdeveloped -> many texts are hard coded german

property professions: list[Profession]

list of all professions available in this world. professions defines starting money, item, skills as well as future potential to learn skills

property races: list[Race]

list of all races in this world. races define some basic properties of a hero.

property regions: list[Region]

list of all regions available in this world. This is a quite complex file.

property reward_sets: list[RewardSet]

list of reward sets. a rewardset enables chance-based rewards

property skills: list[Skill]

All skills available in this world

tungeon.config.game_config.game_config() → GameConfiguration[source]
tungeon.config.game_config.set_game_config(configuration_folder)[source]
